brewery.brewery_description: In 1844, the Rochdale pioneers had an idea that changed the world. They believed in a different way of doing business - that would be owned by its members and work for the common good. They believed that when people worked together they were stronger; principles are more valuable than profits. In WW1, The Co-op were the first to introduce rationing to make sure everyone got their share. It was the start of a national movement that people joined with pride. A movement that never stopped trying to change the way things were done. A movement that was destined to be different. The customers own the Co-op, therefore it is customers who get the benefits of co-operative trade. We’re the UK’s fifth biggest food retailer with more than 2,500 stores.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 455 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower.

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 215 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 44!

items.badge_name: Wake Up and Smell The Coffee!
items.badge_description: Coffee has long been a flavor counterpart for stouts and porters, which means Coffee's not just for breakfast anymore. That's 5 different beers with the style of Porter - Coffee, Porter - Imperial / Double Coffee, Stout - Imperial / Double Coffee, or Stout - Coffee. Try 5 more for Level 2!

items.badge_description: What happens when you take two or more amazing breweries, throw them into the tank and let them ferment together? An amazing collaboration beer, that’s what! Cheers to working together to create the perfect flavor. That's 95 different beers that have been brewed as a collaboration. Try 5 more for Level 20!

items.checkin_comment: It's a lot better than it ought to be for a beer brewed by Robinsons for the coop! Coffee stout with nice milk and chocolate malt notes. I find these sweet stouts work better at lower abv, stops them getting over sweet.

beer.beer_description: A dark mysterious, ebony coloured stout with beautiful roasted malts that give rise to delicious coffee and chocolate aromas, a well balanced bittersweet flavour and smooth creamy finish.
Brewed for the Co-op by Robinsons.

Hops – Goldings (UK), Cascade (USA), Bramling Cross (UK), Target (UK), Bobek (Slovenia). 
“Good traditional IPA. Voluminous, good body and fruity hop.” Tom Packman, Co-op Member Essex
Brewed for the Co-op by Robinsons.

A stunning ruby red ale with toffee and malt notes coming through from the rye and pale malts. A clever blend of Aurora, Celeia and Golding hops give rise to a delicate balance of fruit and deep blackcurrant with a lingering bitterness.
Brewed by Robinson's for Co-operative stores. Vegetarian and Vegan.

A refreshing pale ale with zesty citris fruit coming through from the amarillo hops.

A crisp,dry ale to quench your thirst. Serve chilled but not too cold to appreciate the flavours. Works perfectly with barbecued chicken, grilled fish and potato salad.
Bavarian Weissbier
The Co-Operative's bestselling Premium British dry cider. Serve chilled.

This Fairtrade Ale is produced using the finest Chilean Wild Flower Fairtrade Honey, and the best of British malt and hops. The barley is now sourced from Co-operative Farms in Gloucestershire and the hops from Worcestershire.

Bumble Bee Fairtrade Honey Ale brewed and created by Freeminer reflect its origins in the bottle. At 4.6% abv this is a refreshing beer with subtle hop flavours blending with a premium malt character, and a sublime parting note of wild flowers growing on a Chilean hillside memorable until the next bottle.
Honey Ale was the first ever licensed own label Fairtrade beer when it was first launched in 2005. Best served chilled.
A dark mysterious, ebony coloured stout with beautiful roasted malts that give rise to delicious coffee and chocolate aromas, a well balanced bittersweet flavour and smooth creamy finish.
Brewed by Robinsons exclusively for Co-op stores
Brewed for Co-op Stores UK by Saint-Omer.
Full flavour. Distinctive and refreshing.
A premium quality cider made using the best apples to give a distinctive full flavour and aroma
Light crisp
Beer brewed by The Freeminer Brewery for the Co-Operative Society.
Cheap supermarket mass produced bitter

beer.beer_name: Co-op Sourced Locally Traditional Pale Ale
beer.beer_description:
A full bodied beer, mid brown in colour, with a medium bitterness and grassy, resinous aromas from the English hops, Goldings and Fuggles.

Available from East of England Co-op branches in 500ml bottles.
Tillington Hills 20th Anniversary Limited Edition Premium Dry Cider

Brewed in co-hoperation with Calvors to celebrate the 150th Anniversary of the East of England Co-op. English malts & hops give this traditional pale ale a light, hoppy aroma with a malty and satisfying backbone.

Limited Edition 

Traditionally made Co-op Irresistible Cider is flavoured with cranberry and clementine. This vibrant and fruity blend is an ideal summer drink that may remind you of a classic summer cocktail.
